Chana Masala

Jump to Recipe

Chana Masala, a beloved dish in Indian cuisine, is a delightful combination of hearty chickpeas and aromatic spices that brings warmth and flavor to your table. This vegan and gluten-free recipe is not only easy to prepare but also packed with protein and fiber, making it a wholesome choice for any meal. Whether you are looking for a quick weeknight dinner or a satisfying dish to impress your guests, Chana Masala's vibrant spices and rich taste are sure to please. In this article, we will guide you through the simple steps to create this delicious Chickpea Curry, highlighting the essential ingredients and cooking techniques that will elevate your dish. Get ready to enjoy a taste of India in your own kitchen!

Ingredients

canned chickpeas

Canned chickpeas are convenient and save time. If you prefer fresh, you can soak and cook dried chickpeas (1 cup dried equals about 2 cans). Always rinse canned chickpeas to remove excess sodium and improve flavor.

canned diced tomatoes

Canned diced tomatoes provide great flavor and texture. If fresh tomatoes are available, you can use about 4 medium tomatoes, chopped. For a richer taste, consider using fire-roasted canned tomatoes.

onion

Use a yellow or white onion for the best flavor balance. If you're short on time, shallots can be a good substitute. To enhance sweetness, you can caramelize the onions for a deeper flavor.

garlic

Fresh minced garlic is best for flavor. If you don't have fresh, garlic powder can be used as a substitute (1/8 teaspoon per clove). Roasting garlic can also add a sweet, rich flavor.

ginger

Fresh ginger is ideal for its pungent flavor. If unavailable, ground ginger can be used (1/4 teaspoon for 1 inch fresh). Grating ginger enhances its flavor, so avoid using powdered forms if possible.

chili powder

Adjust the amount based on your heat preference. If you prefer milder spice, use paprika or a mild chili powder. For more heat, consider cayenne pepper or a spicy chili blend.

ground cumin

Cumin adds warmth and earthiness. For a more intense flavor, toast the seeds before grinding them or use whole seeds instead (1 teaspoon seeds equals 1/2 teaspoon ground).

ground coriander

Ground coriander provides citrusy notes; toast the seeds before grinding for enhanced flavor. If unavailable, you can substitute with fennel seeds for a different but pleasant flavor profile.

garam masala

Garam masala is a blend of spices; make your own by combining equal parts of cumin, coriander, cardamom, and cinnamon if you don't have it. Add it towards the end of cooking to preserve its aromatic qualities.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil is great for sautéing. If you'd like a different flavor, use coconut oil or ghee, which are traditional in Indian cooking.

salt

Always taste your dish before adding salt, especially if using canned ingredients as they can be high in sodium. You can use sea salt or kosher salt for a cleaner taste.

fresh cilantro

Fresh cilantro adds brightness; if you're not a fan, try parsley or mint as substitutes. Add it just before serving to maintain its fresh flavor.

lemon juice

Fresh lemon juice enhances the dish's brightness. If fresh lemons aren't available, bottled lemon juice can be used, but fresh is always preferable for flavor.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Heat the olive oil

    In a large pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. This oil will help prevent sticking and add flavor to the dish.

  • Step 2: Sauté the onions

    Add 1 medium chopped onion to the pan. Sauté until the onion becomes translucent, which should take about 5 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.

  • Step 3: Add garlic and ginger

    Stir in 3 minced garlic cloves and 1 inch of grated ginger. Cook for another minute, stirring continuously to avoid burning the garlic.

  • Step 4: Mix in spices

    Add 1 teaspoon each of chili powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, and salt to taste. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. This step enhances the flavors of the spices.

  • Step 5: Incorporate tomatoes

    Stir in 1 can of diced tomatoes (do not drain) and cook for 5 minutes. This will create a rich base for your chana masala.

  • Step 6: Add chickpeas

    Drain and rinse 2 cans of chickpeas, then add them to the pan. Mix well and let it simmer for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

  • Step 7: Finish with garam masala and lemon juice

    Stir in 1 teaspoon of garam masala and 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. The garam masala adds depth, while the lemon juice brightens the dish.

  • Step 8: Garnish and serve

    Remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve your Chana Masala hot with rice or naan.

Frequently Asked Questions

What can I substitute for fresh ginger?

If you don't have fresh ginger, you can use 1/2 teaspoon of ground ginger as a substitute. It won't be as vibrant, but it will still add flavor.

How do I properly chop an onion without crying?

To reduce tears, chill the onion in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes before cutting. Also, use a sharp knife to make clean cuts, which can help minimize the release of tear-inducing compounds.

How do I drain and rinse canned chickpeas?

Simply open the can and pour the chickpeas into a colander. Rinse them under cold water for about 30 seconds to remove excess sodium and any canning liquid.

What if I don’t have garam masala?

If you don't have garam masala, you can create a simple mix using equal parts of ground cumin, coriander, and a little cinnamon. It won’t be exactly the same, but it will still add warmth to your dish.

How do I know when the onions are translucent?

Cook the chopped onions over medium heat, stirring occasionally. They should become soft and lose their raw, opaque appearance, turning slightly golden after about 5 minutes.

Can I use fresh tomatoes instead of canned diced tomatoes?

Yes! You can use about 2-3 medium fresh tomatoes, chopped. You may need to cook them a bit longer to break down into a sauce.

How do I know when the chickpeas are done cooking?

The chickpeas should be heated through and tender. You can taste a few to ensure they’re warm and well mixed with the spices.

What can I use instead of cilantro for garnish?

If you're not a fan of cilantro, you can use chopped parsley or green onions as a fresh garnish instead.

How do I store leftovers?

Let the chana masala cool completely, then transfer it to an airtight container. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

What is the best way to serve chana masala?

Chana masala is delicious served over rice or with naan. You can also serve it with a side of yogurt to balance the spices.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

Chana Masala is naturally vegan and gluten-free, making it suitable for a variety of dietary preferences. For a lower-calorie option, consider reducing the amount of olive oil used. To enhance the dish, you can add extra vegetables such as spinach or bell peppers for added nutrition and flavor. If you're looking for a spicier kick, increase the amount of chili powder or add green chilies while cooking.

Pairings

For a delightful Chana Masala experience, pair it with fluffy basmati rice or warm naan bread to soak up the flavorful sauce. For a protein boost, serve alongside grilled chicken or tandoori fish. When it comes to beverages, a chilled mango lassi or a crisp Indian lager complements the spices beautifully. For a non-alcoholic option, consider a refreshing mint lemonade.

Serving Suggestions

Serve Chana Masala in a wide bowl to showcase its vibrant colors, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro and a wedge of lemon on the side for an extra zing. Consider serving it on a traditional thali alongside small bowls of cucumber raita, pickles, and papadam for a full Indian meal experience. For a more casual setting, serve family-style in a larger dish, allowing guests to help themselves.

#

Chana Masala

30 min
$10
350 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

VeganGluten-Free

Cuisine:

Indian

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

QuickHealthySpicy

Description

A flavorful chickpea curry that's easy to prepare and packed with spices.

Ingredients

  • canned chickpeas: 2 cans
  • canned diced tomatoes: 1 can
  • onion: 1 medium, chopped
  • garlic: 3 cloves, minced
  • ginger: 1 inch, grated
  • chili powder: 1 teaspoon
  • ground cumin: 1 teaspoon
  • ground coriander: 1 teaspoon
  • garam masala: 1 teaspoon
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • fresh cilantro: for garnish
  • lemon juice: 1 tablespoon
